intro: Pinalia leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered pinalia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a fuzzy texture. Pinalia leucantha is primarily grown for ornamental purposes due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
